title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 13 November 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Lyes> has quit  
02:11 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
02:16 <Lyes> has quit  
02:26 <sburjan> has quit  
04:00 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
04:04 <Lyes> has quit  
05:09 <benoitc\_> has joined #xwiki  
05:12 <benoitc> has quit  
05:15 <benoitc\_> is now known as <benoitc>  
05:48 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
05:53 <Lyes> has quit  
06:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
07:42 <Lyes> has quit  
08:08 <cjd> has quit  
08:23 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <cjd> !later tell woshilapin test  
09:15 <forkbot> cjd: The operation succeeded.  
09:15 <cjd> I probably used the wrong name  
09:15 <woshilapin> Hi cjd  
09:16 <cjd> memoserv  
09:16 <woshilapin> And I get this message once I proved that I'm alive here :-)  
09:17 <cjd> so you have to say something in order to get messages from the bot  
09:17 <woshilapin> yes  
09:18 <cjd> !learn scripting as http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
09:18 <forkbot> cjd: The operation succeeded.  
09:18 <cjd> !scripting  
09:19 <cjd> !learn api as http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation  
09:19 <forkbot> cjd: The operation succeeded.  
09:20 <cjd> !learn install\_tomcat as http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat  
09:20 <forkbot> cjd: The operation succeeded.  
09:20 <cjd> !learn install as install\_tomcat ?  
09:20 <forkbot> cjd: The operation succeeded.  
09:21 <cjd> should call it rtfmbot :)  
09:23 <vmassol> I hope you have not reinvented the wheel and this is a botlet from our IRC Bot :)  
09:23 <cjd> I hope you have not reinvented the wheel, this is a standard supybot, it's not even mine :)  
09:24 <cjd> I just saw someone mention it's on freenode and hypeirc and asked him to join it here  
09:24 <vmassol> ofc I didn't reinvent anything, I used pircbot  
09:24 <vmassol> cjd: what's the relationship with xwiki?  
09:24 <vmassol> if you just need a channel pick another one  
09:24 <cjd> ??  
09:24 <cjd> no, I need it for remember things when people ask them in this channel  
09:24 <cjd> such as "how do I install ...."  
09:24 <cjd> remember a link  
09:24 <vmassol> then please use our official bot  
09:25 <vmassol> instead of reinventing something  
09:25 <vmassol> and help us build our tools  
09:25 <cjd> how?  
09:25 <vmassol> instead of frgzmetning them  
09:25 <vmassol> just add a botlet as a wiki page on xwiki.org  
09:25 <cjd> tell you what, you get the xwiki bot to do that and then I'll ask him to remove the bot  
09:25 <vmassol> and you'll get new commands  
09:25 <cjd> I'm not going to spend \*my\* time reinventing things which exist now  
09:26 <vmassol> what does it do? just remember things? that's very basic  
09:26 <vmassol> xwiki also does remember things you put in wiki pages  
09:26 <vmassol> :)  
09:26 <cjd> #wastingtime  
09:26 <vmassol> yeah my point  
09:27 <cjd> it's a supybot http://ubottu.com/supydocs/supybot-docs/  
09:27 <vmassol> how does that help the xwiki project?  
09:28 <vmassol> (there are plenty of bots around there)  
09:28 <cjd> it helps because I don't have to ferrit out links every time someone asks how to install  
09:28 <vmassol> then why not do this in xwiki land?  
09:29 <vmassol> I already did something similar  
09:29 <vmassol> !search installation  
09:29 <forkbot> vmassol: There were no matching configuration variables.  
09:29 <cjd> because it's reinventing supybot!  
09:29 <vmassol> grrr  
09:29 <vmassol> you even hijacked our bot!  
09:29 <vmassol> here you go  
09:29 <vmassol> I didn't have to remember anything  
09:30 <vmassol> it would be very easy to add a new learn command too  
09:30 <vmassol> would take 5-10 lines of wiki script  
09:30 <cjd> you're trying to reinvent everything and using "don't reinvent everything" as the argument, this is just bizarre  
09:31 <cjd> but if you want the bot out of here, I'll ask the guy to remove it  
09:31 <vmassol> I didn't invent anything again, I 've used pircbot, the only specicic things I did is the xwiki part  
09:31 <cjd> pircbot is not a bot, it's an irc library  
09:32 <vmassol> I don't know the guy you're talking about, nobody knows him in ths project, we don't know how many years he's going to maintain his infrz for the xwikiproject, etc  
09:32 <vmassol> if that guy ants to help xwiki  
09:32 <vmassol> then he should introduce himself  
09:32 <vmassol> on the list  
09:32 <vmassol> and explain what he's interested in doing  
09:33 <vmassol> pircbot is a bot  
09:33 <vmassol> you just need to start it  
09:33 <vmassol> anyway our bot wraps pircbot  
09:34 <cjd> I asked him to remove it, I don't want to talk about this anymore because it's just making me angry  
09:35 <vmassol> you could at least have explained what you wanted to do…  
09:36 <vmassol> you just barge in with spam  
09:36 <vmassol> no explanation  
09:36 <vmassol> using some other tool that does something very very similar to a tool we already use  
09:37 <vmassol> so that makes me cruious  
09:37 <vmassol> \*curious  
09:38 <woshilapin> I don't understand how similar because I don't understand how to do the same thing with bots that are already here  
09:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <vmassol> woshilapin: there's some doc here : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application  
09:39 <vmassol> it lists existing features  
09:39 <vmassol> but also how to add new commands  
09:39 <vmassol> ( http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/IRC+Bot+Application#HAddinganewBotListener )  
09:40 <woshilapin> OK, but why reinventing the wheel  
09:40 <vmassol> exactly  
09:40 <vmassol> so we agree :)  
09:40 <woshilapin> And there is not such thing like "alias" or "learn"  
09:40 <woshilapin> in the xwiki bot  
09:40 <vmassol> where do you store the data?  
09:41 <vmassol> how do you maintain it?  
09:41 <woshilapin> We don't maintain Java  
09:41 <vmassol> how do you control who sees it?  
09:41 <vmassol> how do you control who adds data there?  
09:41 <vmassol> java?  
09:41 <vmassol> wtf?  
09:41 <vmassol> you need an infra  
09:42 <woshilapin> I mean if we're don't want to use external components to develop, we should recode Java, Eclipse and all the library  
09:42 <vmassol> to run a bot  
09:42 <woshilapin> It's a non sense to ask "how do you maintain it"  
09:42 <vmassol> you're missing the point  
09:42 <vmassol> woshilapin: you say that because you psend 0% of your time helping out maintaining xwiki.org  
09:42 <vmassol> if you were you'd know it's not free  
09:43 <woshilapin> Yes, and somebody is doint it for us here  
09:43 <woshilapin> Anyway, I think you already made your point clear  
09:43 <woshilapin> My only surprise here is  
09:43 <vmassol> I already emtnioned that if some guy/company is willing to make some infra offer, they should introduce themselves  
09:44 <vmassol> at least we should know who they are  
09:44 <woshilapin> It would be cool to accept things even if not perfect and learn how to improve later (take over the bot, stores data, involve the guy in the comunity)  
09:44 <vmassol> I'm +1 for that, but explain what you're doing at least  
09:44 <woshilapin> Maybe in 2 weeks, nobody use this bot and it will die before we loose 3 weeks to make it work as you tell  
09:45 <vmassol> (I still don'tknow what's your use case and that bot is doing except giving links)  
09:46 <woshilapin> One function is alias  
09:46 <vmassol> and if you're doing your experiment here instead of in a private channel it means you want everyone to participate  
09:46 <woshilapin> Other function is telling somebody something when he is not connected to IRC  
09:47 <vmassol> ok, any use case in mind?  
09:47 <woshilapin> Remove Skype ?  
09:47 <woshilapin> :-)  
09:47 <woshilapin> (for asynchroneous messages I mean)  
09:47 <vmassol> hmm… this is irc not skype…  
09:48 <vmassol> the xwiki projec tis not using skype  
09:48 <vmassol> not sure what you mean...  
09:48 <vmassol> ah I see  
09:48 <vmassol> being able to send offline messages  
09:48 <vmassol> we did an experiment on this here a few years ago  
09:48 <vmassol> using jabber servers  
09:49 <vmassol> it never really worked, possibily becaue the jabber servers we used had memory issues...  
09:50 <vmassol> other problem is flooding  
09:50 <vmassol> when you connect back  
09:50 <vmassol> and you get all the messages you didn't see  
09:51 <vmassol> the way we solved this issue so far is by logging everything in this channel  
09:51 <vmassol> and making that visible at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/WebHome  
09:51 <vmassol> (using our irc bot)  
09:51 <woshilapin> Yes but I don't think it completely solve the problem  
09:51 <woshilapin> Because if I reconnect, I will not go against the whole archive to see what I missed  
09:52 <woshilapin> (I say "me", maybe people do it?)  
09:52 <woshilapin> But yes, it's a partial solution indeed  
09:52 <vmassol> I do it from time to tiem  
09:52 <vmassol> actually it's not that bad  
09:52 <vmassol> it's even probably a good thing  
09:52 <vmassol> (that we loose memory)  
09:52 <vmassol> because important things should not be discussed on irc and should go on the list  
09:53 <vmassol> but you can still point people to past discussions  
09:53 <woshilapin> Yes, ok but here, it's for personal messages  
09:54 <woshilapin> Do you use personal messages on IRC in the context of IRC?  
09:54 <vmassol> ah for personal things it's different I agree  
09:54 <woshilapin> I know I do a lot but maybe people don't work like that  
09:54 <vmassol> I don't use IRC for that, I find it a very bad tool  
09:54 <woshilapin> Yes, but you use Skype instead?  
09:54 <woshilapin> I suppose people contact in private sometimes...  
09:55 <vmassol> (it just works everywhere)  
09:55 <woshilapin> So you have a need for private messages and the asynchroneous functionality is good  
09:55 <vmassol> and most people use itknow how to use it… now ask your mom to use IRC ;)  
09:56 <woshilapin> Of course but here is for devs I think, not for my mom or yours (or am I missing a point ?)  
09:56 <vmassol> the point is that skype is ubiquitous  
09:57 <woshilapin> Yes I know but not open (maybe I'm too extremist) :-)  
09:58 <woshilapin> And by the way, it's not ideal on Linux  
09:58 <vmassol> yeah I don't know about that, I'm lucky to be on mac and it works well  
09:59 <vmassol> (but I do discuss with lots of people on linux with skyoe and it seems to work)  
09:59 <woshilapin> Mac is not open too (I'm getting into a troll here so we should stop right away)  
09:59 <woshilapin> :-P  
09:59 <vmassol> I don't care about open/not open personally, all I want is the best tool for the job  
09:59 <vmassol> if the best is open then great  
10:00 <vmassol> if I can help make the best open tool then even better :)  
10:00 <vmassol> (hence xwiki)  
10:00 <vmassol> but I'm not going to fight on all fronts  
10:00 <vmassol> if I win 10% productivity more with a non open tool and thus get that 10% into xwiki (an open tool) then I'm happy  
10:01 <vmassol> :)  
10:01 <vmassol> I'm probably a pragmatic…  
10:09 <cjd> friday is tomorrow :P  
10:12 <cjd> woshilapin: http://lib.ru/DPEOPLE/PARKINSON/parkinson.txt  
10:13 <cjd> vmassol: you might find that an interesting book too  
10:15 <vmassol> thanks  
10:27 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <vmassol> woshilapin: make sure to use references instead of full URLs when you can in links (this allows to support automatic renames)  
10:41 <woshilapin> I was not sure how to do it since it's a different wiki  
10:41 <vmassol> wiki:space.page  
10:43 <woshilapin> Yes, I know that but I used [[documentation>>extension:Extension.IRC Bot Application]] and didn't work  
10:43 <vmassol> would be awesome if we could auto transform external links into internal links automaitcally btw  
10:44 <woshilapin> I did a typo or something is completely wrong?  
10:44 <vmassol> you kept the + I guess  
10:44 <woshilapin> Nope  
10:44 <woshilapin> So maybe a typo then  
10:44 <vmassol> extensions:Extension.IRC Bot Application  
10:44 <vmassol>  is correct  
10:45 <vmassol> extensions  
10:45 <vmassol> plural  
10:45 <woshilapin> Yes, I pretty sure I missed this one  :-)  
10:45 <vmassol> we do need auto complete on links....  
10:45 <woshilapin> ...I'm pretty...  
10:47 <woshilapin> It was a correction of my previous sentence but just reading this one looks a bit weird :-)  
10:50 <vmassol> you're free to think whatever you want?  
11:03 <vmassol> s/want/want!  
11:03 <vmassol> :)  
11:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw someone asked for the debian packaging for versions 6.2.4 I think (or 6.3). Do we have to do aynthing specific to make our distrib available through DEB? Should we add a step in the release process?  
11:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: nothing to do  
11:15 <tmortagne> it's automatically updated every days  
11:15 <vmassol> ah ok so there's potnetially one day of lag  
11:15 <vmassol> anyway to force it?  
11:15 <vmassol> s/anyway/any wa/  
11:16 <tmortagne> see the crontab on maven.xwiki.org  
11:16 <tmortagne> you will find the command to execute  
11:16 <vmassol> ok so maybe we should add this to the release process  
11:16 <vmassol> so that all our distributions are avail when we announce the new release  
11:16 <tmortagne> I don't think it's critical  
11:16 <vmassol> well pepople do ask and wonder  
11:17 <tmortagne> not much

13:45 <Chuguniy> has quit  
14:23 <Lyes> has quit  
14:55 <msmeria> has quit  
15:32 <Enygma`> tmortagne: subwiki creation on master is broken again but to unrendered velocity code in the DW  
15:32 <gdelhumeau\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <gdelhumeau\_> has left #xwiki  
15:33 <tmortagne> Enygma`: that's weird, I will check that  
15:34 <Enygma`> tmortagne: this is what I get http://i.imgur.com/MbrBzS8.png  
15:34 <Enygma`> I remember seeing this some time ago as well, looks like it`s back  
15:34 <Enygma`> I`ve checked 6.3 and it`s ok  
15:34 <Enygma`> so problems are only on master  
15:34 <tmortagne> I can reproduce, I will debug it  
15:35 <Enygma`> thanks  
15:35 <tmortagne> and looks like we really need some UI test on this...  
15:36 <Enygma`> read my mind...  
16:14 <tmortagne> Enygma`: should be ok now  
16:15 <Enygma`> cool, thanks tmortagne  
16:15 <tmortagne> silly mistake in a refactoring  
16:56 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
17:11 <gsmeria> has quit  
17:11 <woshilapin> has quit  
17:18 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
17:30 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
17:30 <Lyes> has quit  
17:42 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
17:45 <rodrigo\_> has joined #xwiki  
17:46 <rodrigo\_> hello, what versioncan be used with jdk 6?  
17:48 <vmassol> hi rodrigo\_  
17:48 <tmortagne> rodrigo\_: anything lower than 6.0  
17:48 <vmassol> I'm preparing a new FAQ entry for you  
17:50 <rodrigo\_> great!!! Thank  
17:51 <rserra> And the last version to use JDK6?  
17:51 <vmassol> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Which+XWiki+version+is+compatible+with+Java+6  
17:51 <vmassol> :)  
17:52 <rserra> thanks!!!!
